HDG.LOG.content: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]

HDG.IM.content: point is to restore historical Dasein of human beings
HDG.IM.linkedContent: point is to restore historical Dasein of human beings

HDG.IM.content: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history
HDG.IM.linkedContent: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision
HDG.IM.linkedContent: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.IM.content: fall, bad times: flight of gods, destruction of earth, reduction of human beings to a mass, preeminence of mediocre [aren’t these all Nietzschean?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: fall, bad times: flight of gods, destruction of earth, reduction of human beings to a mass, preeminence of mediocre [aren’t these all Nietzschean?]

HDG.IM.content: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]

HDG.IM.content: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]

HDG.IM.content: [re: science] hide loss of spirit through unconscious mendacity [Freud]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [re: science] hide loss of spirit through unconscious mendacity [Freud]

HDG.IM.content: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]

HDG.BC.content: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable
HDG.BC.linkedContent: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable

HDG.BC.content: true/wakeful youth has prerogative to develop exhortations to knowledge from out of itself [?] > can the American man know what “reading” means? [w/ all his “newspapers,” social media] > awaken/keep awake binding power of spirit/bindingness of essential
HDG.BC.linkedContent: true/wakeful youth has prerogative to develop exhortations to knowledge from out of itself [?] > can the American man know what “reading” means? [w/ all his “newspapers,” social media] > awaken/keep awake binding power of spirit/bindingness of essential

HDG.BC.content: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth
HDG.BC.linkedContent: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth

HDG.BC.content: “Will to Power,” all human planning a great “game,” “world-play,” a world coming out of joint
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “Will to Power,” all human planning a great “game,” “world-play,” a world coming out of joint

HDG.BC.content: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

HDG.BC.content: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”

HDG.BC.content: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia

HDG.BC.content: success [in science] never proof of truth, always “consequence” of a grounding principle that must be questioned, never decided by continually dependent result
HDG.BC.linkedContent: success [in science] never proof of truth, always “consequence” of a grounding principle that must be questioned, never decided by continually dependent result

HDG.BC.content: [humanism in science] freedom equated w/ physical unpredictability: physically pre-interpret everything human > phrase unpredictability doesn’t overcome causality
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [humanism in science] freedom equated w/ physical unpredictability: physically pre-interpret everything human > phrase unpredictability doesn’t overcome causality

HDG.BC.content: science only cares about beings, any arbitrary/approximate notion of Being may/does suffice
HDG.BC.linkedContent: science only cares about beings, any arbitrary/approximate notion of Being may/does suffice

HDG.BC.content: philosophical critique of contemporary physics [science], reflection can’t limit itself to examination of “law of causality” > predictability a principle of knowledge of beings, so even physics converts ontological law into “epistemological principle” (an error, a fall), “quantum metaphysics” > science helps indicate “being” as most intelligible (hardly noticed attitude at bottom of claim of physics)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: philosophical critique of contemporary physics [science], reflection can’t limit itself to examination of “law of causality” > predictability a principle of knowledge of beings, so even physics converts ontological law into “epistemological principle” (an error, a fall), “quantum metaphysics” > science helps indicate “being” as most intelligible (hardly noticed attitude at bottom of claim of physics)

HDG.BC.content: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]

HDG.BC.content: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being

HDG.BC.content: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]

HDG.BC.content: Being withdraws from us when we say it > “Being has singularly burst open our human essence” > “we belong to Being, and yet not” >  homeless in our ownmost homeland, not directly allowed in—assuming we may thus name our own essence
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being withdraws from us when we say it > “Being has singularly burst open our human essence” > “we belong to Being, and yet not” > homeless in our ownmost homeland, not directly allowed in—assuming we may thus name our own essence

HDG.WM.content: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy
HDG.WM.linkedContent: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy

HDG.WM.content: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]

HDG.WM.content: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)
HDG.WM.linkedContent: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)

HDG.WM.content: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

HDG.WM.content: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]

HDG.WM.content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks
HDG.WM.linkedContent: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.IWM.content: metaphysics as barrier that refuses human beings primordial relation (anfänglichen Bezug) of Being to the human essence [cf. 281n X Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: metaphysics as barrier that refuses human beings primordial relation (anfänglichen Bezug) of Being to the human essence [cf. 281n X Being]

HDG.IWM.content: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]

HDG.IWM.content: being that exists is the human being, not rocks, not horse, not trees, not angels, not God [Being does not exist?] [cf. 284n X Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: being that exists is the human being, not rocks, not horse, not trees, not angels, not God [Being does not exist?] [cf. 284n X Being]

HDG.IWM.content: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being

HDG.IWM.content: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]

HDG.QB.content: on planetary character of nihilism, consumes everything, flight from this reality in logistics, sociology, psychology [human sciences]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: on planetary character of nihilism, consumes everything, flight from this reality in logistics, sociology, psychology [human sciences]

HDG.QB.content: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”
HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

HDG.QB.content: to what extent essence of “being” is intrinsically a relation to human essence? [Being needs humans]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to what extent essence of “being” is intrinsically a relation to human essence? [Being needs humans]

HDG.QB.content: if Ge-stell only a function of Gestalt, essential unfolding (Wesen) of Being and above all Being of beings (das Sein des Seienden) would be a product (Gemächte) of human representation
HDG.QB.linkedContent: if Ge-stell only a function of Gestalt, essential unfolding (Wesen) of Being and above all Being of beings (das Sein des Seienden) would be a product (Gemächte) of human representation

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: crossing the line entails a transformation of our saying (Sagen), demands a transformed relation to essence of language? > if you, Jünger, represent language of sciences as nominalism, mustn’t you characterize your own relation to language differently?
HDG.QB.linkedContent: crossing the line entails a transformation of our saying (Sagen), demands a transformed relation to essence of language? > if you, Jünger, represent language of sciences as nominalism, mustn’t you characterize your own relation to language differently?

HDG.QB.content: say too little of Being when directed to human essence, say too much when we mean all-encompassing and make human one particular entity among others [Being needs human] [usage of Being]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: say too little of Being when directed to human essence, say too much when we mean all-encompassing and make human one particular entity among others [Being needs human] [usage of Being]

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

HDG.QB.content: crossing through (Durchkreuzung) not merely negative sign of a crossing out: X as four regions of fourfold > human essence belongs, in X of Being, to that which takes thinking into claim of a more originary call [e.g. X Being would imply replacement w/ Ereignis]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: crossing through (Durchkreuzung) not merely negative sign of a crossing out: X as four regions of fourfold > human essence belongs, in X of Being, to that which takes thinking into claim of a more originary call [e.g. X Being would imply replacement w/ Ereignis]

HDG.QB.content: like X Being, nothing would also have to be written [differance, writing], thought in same way, human essence belongs to nothing in its thoughtful commemoration, human being essentially participates in nihilism, he himself is this zone & line [re: overcoming nihilism]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: like X Being, nothing would also have to be written [differance, writing], thought in same way, human essence belongs to nothing in its thoughtful commemoration, human being essentially participates in nihilism, he himself is this zone & line [re: overcoming nihilism]

HDG.QB.content: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings
HDG.QB.linkedContent: surpassing (Überstieg) is metaphysics itself, not a doctrine, but fact that such surpassing is “given” > given in sense of brought onto path of its prevailing, destined > destiny of (objective genitive [control genitive]) metaphysics: incalculable fullness/suddenness (unberechenbare Fülle und Jähe) of what unfolds as surpassing > acc. this destiny, human representation (Vorstellen) itself becomes metaphysical > the surpassing that returns to beings, “the transcendens pure & simple,” is “the being” of beings

HDG.QB.content: sciences believe representation of being exhausts entire realm of what can be researched, apart from beings there’s “nothing else” > metaphysics distinguished by science by the surpassing: Being of beings > for science, Being can only present itself as nothing > how do things stand w/ that which is totally other (ganz Anderen) than anything that is, that which is not a being (i.e. Being)? [Being not crossed out]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: sciences believe representation of being exhausts entire realm of what can be researched, apart from beings there’s “nothing else” > metaphysics distinguished by science by the surpassing: Being of beings > for science, Being can only present itself as nothing > how do things stand w/ that which is totally other (ganz Anderen) than anything that is, that which is not a being (i.e. Being)? [Being not crossed out]

HDG.QB.content: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]

HDG.FS.content: Heraclitus doesn’t combine opposites [dialectic], he names diapheromenon as sympheromenon > [fragment 50] human thinking, its noein, belongs to logos, determines itself (from this) as omologein
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heraclitus doesn’t combine opposites [dialectic], he names diapheromenon as sympheromenon > [fragment 50] human thinking, its noein, belongs to logos, determines itself (from this) as omologein

HDG.FS.content: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth
HDG.FS.linkedContent: logos as gathering, “projects itself toward things that appear in their gathering” > for Greek thought, presencing of human is opening inception for oppositional presencing of World > alētheia: encounter (Begegnung) btwn that which presences and being is a self-opening, welcomes (Empfang) presence [a site, Ort?] > alētheia can’t be translated as truth

HDG.FS.content: no system strictly speaking in Kant, Kant speaks of unconditioned necessity, which humans require, as abyss, eternity itself in its terrible sublimity > God, for Kant, appears as abyss, “The Impossibility of Cosmological Proof of the Existence of God” = system’s impossibility
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no system strictly speaking in Kant, Kant speaks of unconditioned necessity, which humans require, as abyss, eternity itself in its terrible sublimity > God, for Kant, appears as abyss, “The Impossibility of Cosmological Proof of the Existence of God” = system’s impossibility

HDG.FS.content: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics
HDG.FS.linkedContent: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: Greeks lived immediately in openness of phenomena—through expressly ek-static capacity of letting phenomena speak to them (modern man, via Descartes, only talks to himself, human as representer), no Greek word for being of human in alētheia, not due to lack, but due to excess > belonging to alētheia as Greek destiny: moira
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Greeks lived immediately in openness of phenomena—through expressly ek-static capacity of letting phenomena speak to them (modern man, via Descartes, only talks to himself, human as representer), no Greek word for being of human in alētheia, not due to lack, but due to excess > belonging to alētheia as Greek destiny: moira

HDG.FS.content: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns

HDG.FS.content: [machine & event?] can a thinker ever reconcile these 2 “realms” that have grown foreign to one another: “technologically dominable nature of science” and “natural nature of the…dwelling of man” [reflections on Gelassenheit, comportment (Haltung) of “self-joining (Sicheinfügens),” cautious sheltering, opening to secret (Geheimnis)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [machine & event?] can a thinker ever reconcile these 2 “realms” that have grown foreign to one another: “technologically dominable nature of science” and “natural nature of the…dwelling of man” [reflections on Gelassenheit, comportment (Haltung) of “self-joining (Sicheinfügens),” cautious sheltering, opening to secret (Geheimnis)]

HDG.FS.content: “philosophy” today behind science, misses 2 sole realities of today: 1) development of business (der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung) 2) correlated armament (Rüstung) [Marxism knows these realities]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “philosophy” today behind science, misses 2 sole realities of today: 1) development of business (der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung) 2) correlated armament (Rüstung) [Marxism knows these realities]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through
HDG.FS.linkedContent: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: reality of America veiled from view of those interested: collusion btwn industry/military > decision does not belong to humans, w/out this insight (man not a being that makes himself [contra Sartrean existentialism?]), sd remain w/in political opposition of civil/industrial society > society (Gesellschaft): a mirror/extension of subjectivity
HDG.FS.linkedContent: reality of America veiled from view of those interested: collusion btwn industry/military > decision does not belong to humans, w/out this insight (man not a being that makes himself [contra Sartrean existentialism?]), sd remain w/in political opposition of civil/industrial society > society (Gesellschaft): a mirror/extension of subjectivity

HDG.FS.content: essential limitation (wesentliche Beschränkung), i.e. finitude (Endlichkeit), condition of genuine (echten) existence: for truly living human, always time
HDG.FS.linkedContent: essential limitation (wesentliche Beschränkung), i.e. finitude (Endlichkeit), condition of genuine (echten) existence: for truly living human, always time

HDG.FS.content: man is plaything of technology, positionality (Ge-stell) requires man to correspond w/ exploitation/consumption > cybernetics becomes replacement for philosophy/poetry > modern man a slave to forgetfulness of Being, when disciplines (human sciences) bear no relation to their ground
HDG.FS.linkedContent: man is plaything of technology, positionality (Ge-stell) requires man to correspond w/ exploitation/consumption > cybernetics becomes replacement for philosophy/poetry > modern man a slave to forgetfulness of Being, when disciplines (human sciences) bear no relation to their ground

HDG.FS.content: human belongs to openness of Being > Being, for its opening, needs man as the there of its manifestation [Larry’s emphasis] > Ge-stell helps us see that human is “used by being (vom Sein gebraucht),” also the shepherd of being, berger (French is better here), one who provides shelter > that Being needs something of human to be: finitude of being must be assumed (not absolutely for itself, pointed contradiction to Hegel)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: human belongs to openness of Being > Being, for its opening, needs man as the there of its manifestation [Larry’s emphasis] > Ge-stell helps us see that human is “used by being (vom Sein gebraucht),” also the shepherd of being, berger (French is better here), one who provides shelter > that Being needs something of human to be: finitude of being must be assumed (not absolutely for itself, pointed contradiction to Hegel)

HDG.FS.content: human is the placeholder of the nothing [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: human is the placeholder of the nothing [?]

HDG.FS.content: to leave (verlassen) region (Bereich) of consciousness and attain (erreichen) that of Dasein: to see that “human only exists (ist) in coming from itself to what is wholly other [ganz anderen] than itself, in coming to the clearing of being”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to leave (verlassen) region (Bereich) of consciousness and attain (erreichen) that of Dasein: to see that “human only exists (ist) in coming from itself to what is wholly other [ganz anderen] than itself, in coming to the clearing of being”

HDG.FS.content: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marxism as a whole rests on this thesis [from Early Writings]: “to be radical is to grasp the root of the matter, but for man the root is man himself,” thinks on the basis of production: social production of society, self-production of human being as social being > Marxism is thought of today, where self-production of man & society prevail [isn’t Nietzsche & Hegel also thought of today?] > self-production (Selbstherstellung) raises danger (Gefahr) of self-destruction (Selbstzerstörung)

HDG.FS.content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

HDG.MA.content: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)
HDG.MA.linkedContent: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

HDG.MA.content: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]

HDG.CCP.content: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

HDG.CCP.content: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]

HDG.CCP.content: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

HDG.LP.content: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]

HDG.WL.content: ability to speak marks (zeichnet) man as man, this mark (Aus-Zeichnung) contains (enthält) the design (Aufriss) of man’s essence > language grants to man is foundation of human being, he can speak in terms of “it is” (often remains unspoken)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: ability to speak marks (zeichnet) man as man, this mark (Aus-Zeichnung) contains (enthält) the design (Aufriss) of man’s essence > language grants to man is foundation of human being, he can speak in terms of “it is” (often remains unspoken)

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

HDG.WL.content: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend
HDG.WL.linkedContent: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend

HDG.WL.content: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

HDG.WL.content: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

HDG.TC.content: annihilation affects the human, not humans > “the human is annihilated”: the essence of the human is annihilated > must think back to essence of human (you thinkers always think backwards)
HDG.TC.linkedContent: annihilation affects the human, not humans > “the human is annihilated”: the essence of the human is annihilated > must think back to essence of human (you thinkers always think backwards)

HDG.EC.content: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death

HDG.EC.content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

HDG.EC.content: human individuals spurring on the devastation are subordinate to it, angry functionaries of their own mediocrity (Mittelmässigkeit), stand lower than wretched (Dürftige) who stand w/in their limits
HDG.EC.linkedContent: human individuals spurring on the devastation are subordinate to it, angry functionaries of their own mediocrity (Mittelmässigkeit), stand lower than wretched (Dürftige) who stand w/in their limits

HDG.EC.content: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]

HDG.EC.content: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)

HDG.EC.content: withdrawal of human existence from ground of thinking, burning pain, we were not permitted to be there for the unnecessary, couldn’t be young [not there in ontic]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: withdrawal of human existence from ground of thinking, burning pain, we were not permitted to be there for the unnecessary, couldn’t be young [not there in ontic]

HDG.EC.content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]

HDG.EC.content: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal
HDG.EC.linkedContent: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal

HDG.EC.content: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]

HDG.EC.content: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: those who wait learn right humble contentment (rechte Genügsamkeit), teachers of great poverty (Armut) > that which heals lets our essence wait: in waiting, human gathered in attentiveness to that which he belongs—can’t let himself get carried away (wegzuheben)/absorbed (aufzulösen) in it [danger of attention]

HDG.EC.content: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in waiting we let things into where we ourselves belong, in rest (i.e. in return to themselves) > things, once returning as such, bring their own presence (Gegenwart) from themselves toward (entgegen) us, they fill out the emptiness that seems to gape around us as we wait > by not waiting on this restful repose, by hastening toward progress, humans become pacesetter (Schrittmacher) of devastation

HDG.EC.content: survival of devastation is not about a native kind (Geburtsart) [German nationalism] of human living on, but the pure duration of destiny (die reine Dauer des Geschickes) becom[ing] well-grounded (gut gegründet) by waiting on the coming [arrival?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: survival of devastation is not about a native kind (Geburtsart) [German nationalism] of human living on, but the pure duration of destiny (die reine Dauer des Geschickes) becom[ing] well-grounded (gut gegründet) by waiting on the coming [arrival?]

HDG.EC.content: must attempt to tell friends what is given to them to think, but we ourselves must have “first constantly experienced and examined (erprüft) what is inexhaustibly (unerschöpflichen) given to the human to think”
HDG.EC.linkedContent: must attempt to tell friends what is given to them to think, but we ourselves must have “first constantly experienced and examined (erprüft) what is inexhaustibly (unerschöpflichen) given to the human to think”

HDG.EC.content: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent

HDG.OHF.content: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God

HDG.OHF.content: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession

HDG.OHF.content: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: [historical human sciences shouldn’t imitate history of art?]
[history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]

HDG.OHF.content: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [but] Husserl also held ideal of science, found it prescribed in mathematics: attempted to elevate description to mathematical rigor > mathematics is least rigorous of disciplines: easiest to gain access to [?]

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
